item.title: ‘I went to Greenland to try to buy it’: Meet the founder who wants to re-create Mars on Earth
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
Praxis co-founder Dryden Brown wants to build a city in Greenland that emulates what a community on Mars could be like.

item.title: Think you need a VPN? Start here.
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
Not everyone actually needs to use a VPN. This simple guide will help you decide if you need a VPN for your situation.

item.title: ‘AI granny’ scambaiter wastes telephone fraudsters’ time with boring chat
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Telephone scams are nothing new, but with the advent of AI, it has become harder than ever for people to know whether the person they’re speaking to is in fact who they say they are. But U.K. mobile network O2 is turning the tables, creating what it calls an “AI granny” to keep scammers on […]

item.title: Drone manufacturer Skydio raises $170 million extension round
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl, Sean O'Kane
item.description:
American drone manufacturer Skydio has raised an extension round of $170 million, adding onto the $230 million Series E it closed early last year.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: After raising nearly half a billion dollars, ABL Space pivots from launch vehicles to missiles
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Significant changes are coming to ABL Space Systems. The leader of the 7-year-old startup took to social media last night to make a big announcement: The company will no longer be focusing on the commercial launch market but will be turning instead to missile defense.  ABL had been developing a small launch vehicle called RS1 […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Microsoft bets a carbon removal bake-off will help offset its skyrocketing AI emissions
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Microsoft is buying 10,000 tons of carbon credits from Deep Sky, a direct air capture developer.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: X sues to block California anti-deepfakes bill
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Per Bloomberg, X, Elon Musk’s social media company, has sued to block California law AB 2655, which requires large online platforms to remove or label AI deepfakes related to elections. X argues that the law, also known as the “Defending Democracy from Deepfake Deception Act of 2024,” will lead to widespread censorship of political speech. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: General Motors slashes another 1,000 jobs to cut costs
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
General Motors is laying off nearly 1,000 workers in the U.S. as part of a cost-cutting bid, just three months after cutting 1,000 software jobs. The company told TechCrunch that cuts won’t affect hourly workers at any of its factories, but declined to specify which teams were affected. A significant majority of the layoffs were […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How social app Spill plans to capitalize on the exodus from X
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Social networking rivals continue to benefit from the user exodus from X. Spill, the social app founded by two former Twitter employees, released a statement claiming it has also seen a jump in users after the U.S. presidential election, following similar news by Bluesky, which gained more than 2 million users during that time. The startup, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: As Bluesky surges, Threads begins testing custom feeds
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday announced the company’s X competitor, Threads, would begin testing custom feeds for specific topics and profiles, making it easier for users to find communities and conversations that interest them. The news follows the rapid growth of the social networking startup and X rival, Bluesky, which prioritizes tools that allow […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: JobGet, a ‘LinkedIn’ for hourly workers, acquires rival Snagajob
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
If you’re an hourly worker, the number of go-to options you have for finding new jobs is shrinking a little. JobGet, a Boston-based startup that operates an hourly job-hunting site with social features built in, à la LinkedIn, is acquiring Snagajob, one of its rivals in the U.S. market. JobGet claims this will make it […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meghan Markle is expanding her consumer portfolio
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
InStyle reported yesterday that Meghan Markle is an investor in the hair and wellness company Highbrow Hippie, founded by her colorist Kadi Lee and Myka Harris. The company was announcing the launch of a new hair care line and Meghan told the outlet that she was “proud to invest in her as a friend and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: GM’s Cruise to pay $500,000 fine to DOJ, admits submitting false report
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Cruise, the autonomous vehicle unit of General Motors, has admitted to submitting a false report with the goal of influencing a federal investigation into a safety incident last year. In penance, the company will pay a $500,000 criminal fine as part of a deferred prosecution agreement, per the Department of Justice (DOJ).  This is one […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Angel investor Hannah Bronfman is ready to launch her own fund
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Early Thursday morning, excited AfroTech attendees shuffled into a conference room to see one thing: Hannah Bronfman, a noted angel investor who has more than 1 million followers on social media, in conversation with Blavity founder and CEO Morgan DeBaun.  Bronfman is a wellness content creator, an author, and an investor in more than 70 […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google tests removing news articles from search in EU, but it’s already backfiring
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Under EU law, digital platforms have to pay for news reuse. But how much should Google pay for article previews? That’s what Google is trying to find out with an experiment in nine EU countries. During the test, 1% of users won’t see articles from EU-based news publishers in search and Google News so that […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Musk’s amended lawsuit against OpenAI names Microsoft as defendant
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Elon Musk’s lawsuit against OpenAI accusing the company of abandoning its nonprofit mission was withdrawn in July, only to be revived in August. Now, in an amended complaint, the suit names new defendants, including Microsoft, LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman, and former OpenAI board member and Microsoft VP Dee Templeton. The amended filing also adds new […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Bluesky says 1 million people signed up for the platform in last 24 hours
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Bluesky said Thursday evening that over 1 million people signed up for the platform in the last 24 hours, making it one of the busiest days for the company. This also meant the social network crossed the mark of 16 million users overall. The platform’s announcement comes hours after Instagram head Adam Mosseri said that […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Heroku CEO Bob Wise departs
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Bob Wise, the CEO of Heroku, Salesforce’s cloud platform as a service (PaaS), has left. A Salesforce spokesperson confirmed the news to TechCrunch in a statement via email. “Bob Wise has left Salesforce for his next career move,” the spokesperson said. “We appreciate all that Bob has done for Salesforce and Heroku and we wish […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Tech leaders recommend colleagues for Trump’s cabinet
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Tech executives have been trying to influence the incoming Trump administration to appoint Silicon Valley insiders for cabinet positions, The New York Times reported. Given Elon Musk’s strong relationship with Donald Trump, many of these persuasion efforts have been directed towards him, including by friends of Musk like Joe Lonsdale, the co-founder of Palantir and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FTC reportedly begins investigating Microsoft’s cloud business practices
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The FTC is reportedly readying an investigation into whether Microsoft used anti-competitive tactics to maintain a dominant position in the cloud market. According to Financial Times, the agency is looking into allegations that Microsoft imposed punitive licensing agreements to prevent customers from moving data off its platforms. Sources told FT that the FTC is also […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
